newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London Evening Standard - Jan 15.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London Evening Standard - Jan 15.

text.p: Prepared for Reuters by The Broadcast Monitoring Company

Today a historic deal was reached by Israeli and Palestinian negotiators which could bring peace to the occupied West Bank. The peace settlement signed by Prime Minister Netanyahu and Palestinian leader Yasser Arafat has raised tensions among Jewish hard line settlers.
NORWICH ACCUSED AS PAYOUTS ARE CUT BACK Norwich Union, the insurance giant, has been accused of cutting payouts to some of its endowment policyholders in order to fatten itself up for flotation.
EAST BETTING ON A RATE RISE FROM CLARKE
Far East currency traders were today depending on Chancellor Kenneth Clarke raising British interest rates today. The pound made fresh gains against the dollar and Deutschmark overnight.
MARKS SET TO CAUSE SPARKS DOWN UNDER

Marks and Spencer, giant of British High Streets, is set to expand down under. Australian retailers who have had to contend with a flat Christmas and depressing profit downgrades will face even tougher competition. The expansion is part of 1.1 billion stg earmarked for international growth over the next three years.
